A **crossbow bolt** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. Crossbow bolts are [stackable](/wiki/Stackable "Stackable") [projectiles](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile") designed for use with a [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow"), and are made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [5.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.6 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

All [Gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") start the game with a +1 crossbow and stacks of +0 and +2 crossbow bolts, rather than a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow") and [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow");[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) crossbows and crossbow bolts are considered [racial equipment](/wiki/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment") for gnomes, though gnomish Rangers are the only case where this substitution applies.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

A [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") monster with a weapon attack, the ability to wield weapons and no other ruleset governing its [monster starting inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") has a chance of generating with a crossbow and a set of bolts, unless they are being generated on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level"): the base odds are 1⁄14 for normal monsters, 1⁄12 for a monster that is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") or [nasty](/wiki/Nasty "Nasty"), 1⁄10 for a monster that is an [overlord](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE") or both a lord and nasty, and 1⁄8 for a monster that is both nasty and an overlord.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

[Plains centaurs](/wiki/Plains_centaur "Plains centaur") and [mountain centaurs](/wiki/Mountain_centaur "Mountain centaur") have a 1⁄2 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a crossbow and 3–14 bolts.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) Crossbows and their ammo can also be generated on any monster lacking the [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") [monster attribute](/wiki/Monster_attribute "Monster attribute") that can use a weapon, but has not received one.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

## Description

Like some other [missile](/wiki/Missile "Missile") weapons, [throwing](/wiki/Throw "Throw") or [firing](/wiki/Firing "Firing") crossbow bolts may cause them to [mulch](/wiki/Mulch "Mulch") upon hitting a monster, and cursed bolts will misfire and fly in a different direction or simply hit the ground. Crossbow bolts can be [poisoned](/wiki/Poison "Poison") by dipping them in a [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness").

Crossbow bolts launched from a crossbow will always fire at their maximum range of 8 squares, but are subject to a [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") penalty if their user is below a certain [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") level - gnomes only need must have at least 16 strength to obtain full [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") bonuses, while other races require at least 18 strength in order to avoid multishot penalties. Gnomes who are not [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") or [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") also gain a +1 [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") racial bonus when firing bolts from a crossbow.

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow")*

High-strength characters lacking a ranged weapon may choose to retrieve a crossbow and bolts from the [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_class\) "Gnome (monster class)") in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines"); bolts are somewhat scarce compared to the various arrows that can be found in several monster inventories and [arrow traps](/wiki/Arrow_trap "Arrow trap"). As with most launchers, the bolts themselves should be enchanted rather than the crossbow in order to increase their damage.

[Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") looking to maintain [weaponless](/wiki/Weaponless "Weaponless") conduct may elect to carry a crossbow and bolts on hand; Rogues can also get Expert in crossbow, though they are an uncommon choice of long-term ranged weapon. Gnomish rangers may have to rely on their [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") in the early game to kill their fellow gnomes for additional bolts - the [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest") provides a plentiful source as early as the midgame, though they will also have to look out for attack [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand") while there; their [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), [The Longbow of Diana](/wiki/The_Longbow_of_Diana "The Longbow of Diana"), also forces them to switch launcher and ammo types as well.

## History

Crossbow bolts first appear in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which are based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and are included in the initial weapon list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

The special behavior of bolts with regards to range and multishot is introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces [Hellfire](/wiki/Hellfire_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Hellfire (SLASH'EM)"), a [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") artifact crossbow that causes bolts fired from it to produce a 3x3 fiery explosion centered on any monster that it hits.

[Undead Slayers](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") have a chance of starting the game with a crossbow and bolts.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), crossbows fire bolts at a set range regardless of strength, and require high strength for multishot.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), all gnomish characters in roles that start with a bow and arrows are given a crossbow and bolts, and all gnomes get an extra die of weapon damage when firing bolts from crossbows.

Each shot from a crossbow applies a 3x damage bonus based on current skill level: -5 at Restricted, -2 at Unskilled, +0 at Basic, +2 at Skilled and +5 at Expert. Higher skill levels also apply damage increases for each fired bolt instead of multishot:

- Basic or lower: 1x(bolt+enchantment) damage
- Skilled: 2x(bolt+enchantment) damage
- Expert: 3x(bolt+enchantment) damage

The extra damage is precision-based and does not apply against monsters that are amorphous or stationary, or ones that are incorporeal (as they are assumed to lack discernible weak-points).

Some artifacts, usually artifact crossbows, have various effects related to crossbow bolts:

- [Hellfire](/wiki/Hellfire_\(dNetHack\) "Hellfire (dNetHack)") causes bolts that it fires to explode in a 3x3 radius for 6d6 fire damage if they hit a monster, consuming the bolts in the process.
- [The Unstoppable](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Unstoppable "DNetHack artifacts") causes fired bolts to pierce through hostile monsters on hit, and bolts that miss will continue flying until they hit a wall.
- [Wrathful Spider](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Wrathful_Spider "DNetHack artifacts") fires 1d8 bolts in a single volley: each bolt gains 1⁄2 of the normal damage bonus, bringing the total damage of a volley to twice the base damage in practice. (As with normal projectiles, using the number prefix via [n](/wiki/N "N") when shooting can control the maximum amount of bolts in a volley.)
- [The Rogue Gear-spirits](/wiki/The_Rogue_Gear-spirits "The Rogue Gear-spirits") fires two crossbow bolts at minimum instead of one, and will automatically create and fire +0 crossbow bolts if there is no ammo quivered.
- [Sansara Mirror](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Sansara_Mirror "DNetHack artifacts") grants doubled multishot with any projectile, including crossbow bolts fired from a crossbow, whhile it is wielded or in the off-hand - this does not stack with the effect of The Rogue Gear-spirits.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [merfolk](/wiki/Merfolk_\(starting_race\) "Merfolk (starting race)") characters in roles that would start the game with a bow and arrows receive a crossbow and bolts instead.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [bolt traps](/index.php?title=Bolt_trap\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Bolt trap (page does not exist)") appear in the dungeon that can be [untrapped](/wiki/Untrap "Untrap") to obtain their crossbow bolts.

Gnomish Rangers have their quest artifact changed to [The Crossbow of Carl](/wiki/The_Crossbow_of_Carl "The Crossbow of Carl"), an artifact crossbow that mirrors The Longbow of Diana and can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to [create crossbow bolts](/wiki/Create_ammo "Create ammo") - this allows them to preserve their multishot bonuses and maintain a supply of bolts.

Crossbow bolts can be used to create many items at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)"):

- 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") to create a [javelin](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin").
- 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with a [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") to create a [stiletto](/wiki/Stiletto "Stiletto").
- 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") to create a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword").
- 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with an [elven dagger](/wiki/Elven_dagger "Elven dagger") to create an [elven short sword](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword").
- 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with an [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger") to create an [orcish short sword](/wiki/Orcish_short_sword "Orcish short sword").
- 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with 2 arrows to create a [club](/wiki/Club "Club").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

In EvilHack 0.9.0, The Crossbow of Carl is also the [Hobbit](/wiki/Hobbit_\(starting_race\) "Hobbit (starting race)") Ranger quest artifact.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [Warriors](/wiki/Warrior "Warrior") start each game with a +1 crossbow and a stack of +0 crossbow bolts; Undead Slayers now have a 1⁄2 chance of starting with a crossbow and some bolts.

[Player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") undead slayers and gnomish player monsters that are not [cavepeople](/wiki/Caveman_\(player_monster\) "Caveman (player monster)") are likely to generate with a crossbow and some bolts.

The extra damage is precision-based and does not apply against monsters that are amorphous or stationary, or ones that are incorporeal (as they are assumed to lack discernible weak-points). 

Some artifacts, usually artifact crossbows, have various effects related to crossbow bolts:

* [[Hellfire (dNetHack)|Hellfire]] causes bolts that it fires to explode in a 3x3 radius for 6d6 fire damage if they hit a monster, consuming the bolts in the process.
* [[dNetHack artifacts#The Unstoppable|The Unstoppable]] causes fired bolts to pierce through hostile monsters on hit, and bolts that miss will continue flying until they hit a wall.
* [[dNetHack artifacts#Wrathful Spider|Wrathful Spider]] fires 1d8 bolts in a single volley: each bolt gains {{frac|2}} of the normal damage bonus, bringing the total damage of a volley to twice the base damage in practice. (As with normal projectiles, using the number prefix via {{kbd|n}} when shooting can control the maximum amount of bolts in a volley.)
* [[The Rogue Gear-spirits]] fires two crossbow bolts at minimum instead of one, and will automatically create and fire +0 crossbow bolts if there is no ammo quivered.
* [[dNetHack artifacts#Sansara Mirror|Sansara Mirror]] grants doubled multishot with any projectile, including crossbow bolts fired from a crossbow, whhile it is wielded or in the off-hand - this does not stack with the effect of The Rogue Gear-spirits.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], [[merfolk (starting race)|merfolk]] characters in roles that would start the game with a bow and arrows receive a crossbow and bolts instead.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], [[bolt trap]]s appear in the dungeon that can be [[untrap]]ped to obtain their crossbow bolts.

Gnomish Rangers have their quest artifact changed to [[The Crossbow of Carl]], an artifact crossbow that mirrors The Longbow of Diana and can be [[invoked]] to [[Create ammo|create crossbow bolts]] - this allows them to preserve their multishot bonuses and maintain a supply of bolts.

Crossbow bolts can be used to create many items at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]]:

* 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with a [[spear]] to create a [[javelin]].
* 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with a [[knife]] to create a [[stiletto]].
* 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with a [[dagger]] to create a [[short sword]].
* 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with an [[elven dagger]] to create an [[elven short sword]].
* 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with an [[orcish dagger]] to create an [[orcish short sword]].
* 2 crossbow bolts can be combined with 2 arrows to create a [[club]].

{{upcoming|EvilHack|In EvilHack 0.9.0, The Crossbow of Carl is also the [[Hobbit (starting race)|Hobbit]] Ranger quest artifact.}}

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, [[Warrior]]s start each game with a +1 crossbow and a stack of +0 crossbow bolts; Undead Slayers now have a {{frac|2}} chance of starting with a crossbow and some bolts.

[[Player monster]] undead slayers and gnomish player monsters that are not [[Caveman (player monster)|cavepeople]] are likely to generate with a crossbow and some bolts.
